data-breakfast.desc: Ellie's whole-wheat breakfast burritos make for a hand-held, vegetable-packed way start to your day.
Everything you've ever craved from a diner breakfast is present in this Whole30-friendly recipe, which is easy to prepare for a crowd.
Much like a composed salad, this visually arresting Nordic-inspired bowl of porridge is a delightful way to start the day.
This Mexican dish isn't usually the healthiest breakfast choice, but Sunny Anderson's version is fresh, light and still full of flavor.
Satisfy your paleo cravings with these wholesome waffles, naturally sweetened with pumpkin puree and a quick raspberry compote.
In this reverse-engineered avocado toast, the avocado is coated with crispy garlic breadcrumbs before being topped with a perfect fried egg.
Make this satisfying egg dish for an easy on-the-go breakfast. It's packed with veggies and can be stored in the fridge for the week.
This grainless porridge relies on sweet and tart Honeycrisp apples to make a chunky sauce enriched with coconut milk, cashews and ground flaxseed.
Collards are key to these paleo-friendly breakfast wraps: bacon, eggs and a fresh avocado salsa (think salsa meets gauc) are wrapped up in tender collard leaves
A rice cooker makes a comforting bowl of this four-grain porridge so easy to enjoy.
These twice-baked breakfast potatoes contain all the elements of a brunch feast--eggs, sausage, spuds--contained in one tidy package.
Make a delicious breakfast that really shows your family members you love them.
In this crowd-pleasing recipe, baked eggs sit atop grated summer squash and zucchini, with a healthy dose of spicy pepper Jack cheese, nutmeg and scallions.
Giada's bulks up Greek yogurt with chia seeds for a little bit of crunch and maple syrup for a little bit of sweet ‚Äî it's the perfect healthy make-ahead breakfast.

data-breakfast.dish: Gluten-Free Raisin Bread French Toast Casserole
data-breakfast.desc: This decadent-yet-healthy make-ahead baked French toast is topped with fresh berries ‚Äî and is also gluten-free.
Get in on the delicious smoothie bowl trend with these flavor-packed acai bowls made with fruit, cacao powder and espresso. (And layered with oodles of yummy toppings!)
These healthier pancakes feature a mix of whole-wheat flour and oats and are topped with a naturally sweet apple compote made with fruit, cider and honey.

data-breakfast.dish: Souffle Pancake with Apple Pear Compote
data-breakfast.desc: A make-ahead fruit compote makes this quick fix a great addition to any brunch spread.
Loaded with vegetables and lightened up with egg whites and turkey bacon, this easy frittata is a perfect dish for entertaining at brunch.
This cheesy egg breakfast could make mornings a whole lot more fun. Fresh cilantro and creamy Monterey Jack tame the heat from the tomatillos and jalapenos in the salsa verde.
Start your morning right with Ellie's pancakes, full of whole grains and fresh fruit.

data-breakfast.dish: Broccoli and Cheese Frittata with Tomato Toast
data-breakfast.desc: An easy, cheesy frittata gets a boost of nutrition with the addition of broccoli and a side of garlicky whole-wheat toast with tomato.
Throw together this healthy oatmeal the night before and enjoy it the next morning.
The full-fat Cheddar and Parmesan together are so satisfying in this easy-to-make casserole that a little goes a long way.
This tropical-inspired smoothie is packed with fiber (6 grams per serving), thanks to the fruit and the clever addition of rolled oats.
This satisfying dish takes a traditional breakfast favorite and turns it into a savory version with an almost risotto-like texture.
This high-fiber, low-fat breakfast dish is a crowd pleaser. It's sweet and tender and quicker to make than individual pancakes.
Sure, oatmeal's great with cinnamon and sugar. For a twist, try this savory take: oatmeal paired with the classic combo of ham, eggs and cheese

data-breakfast.dish: Waffled Blueberry French Toast with a Carrot-Ginger Smoothie
data-breakfast.desc: Whole-wheat bread and a homemade blueberry topping make the breakfast extra-nutritious.
Zucchini takes the place of the usual potatoes in this healthy remake of hash browns that's accompanied by fried eggs and whole-wheat toast.
Modify your muffin recipe with low-fat buttermilk and egg whites for a healthier breakfast. Orange zest and raspberries give these muffins their bright color and flavor.

This breakfast bake is easy on the calories and fat, and as pretty as a picture. With its berries and oat-almond topping, it's almost like a tart, sweet fruit cobbler ‚Äî great with a little Greek yogurt or milk on top.
Make light-yet-crispy hash browns using just a tablespoon of oil and a nonstick pan.

This isn't just any old oatmeal. It's like having dessert for breakfast. This recipe has toasty nuts, sweet banana, rich cocoa and just enough chocolate chips to give you a healthy and sweet fix at the same time.
The perfect hybrid of flapjacks and crepes, these protein-packed pancakes are low in calories and fat.
Giada De Laurentiis whips up a dairy-free smoothie that has great nutty flavor, thanks to the walnuts and almond milk. For sweetness, use dried dates ‚Äî just a few will go a long way.
Who needs sugar when you have ripe bananas to sweeten these moist and fluffy gluten-free waffles?

data-breakfast.dish: Savory Curry Granola with Coconut Oil, Nuts and Seeds
data-breakfast.desc: Chef and trainer Eddie Jackson puts a savory spin on granola with Madras curry powder, almonds and 5 kinds of crunchy seeds: pumpkin, sunflower, flax, sesame and chia.
A healthy summer breakfast on the go, this sweet and tart smoothie keeps you full longer thanks to extra fiber from the oats.
Using baked tortilla chips, a mixture of eggs and egg whites, and just a bit of sharp cheddar and pepper Jack keeps the fat low and the flavor high.

data-lunch.desc: Get a sweet taste of summertime with this colorful soup loaded with peas, zucchini, squash, and carrots.
Avoid the dreaded 3 p.m. slump by filling up on this refreshing, protein-packed lunch.

data-lunch.dish: Roasted Salmon with Green Beans and Tomatoes
data-lunch.desc: Keep it classic (and clean) with a plate full of omega-3s and protein.
A splash of maple syrup balances out the spiciness of the chile-infused shredded pork.
Since plum season doesn't last forever, make the most of it by throwing a few charred plums atop a bed of grilled chicken and greens.
Lighten up your plate of pasta by going 50/50 with medley of grilled veggies.
BLTs are great and all, but they aren't necessarily full of all the nutrients you need to keep going.

data-lunch.dish: Vegetable Ramen with Mushrooms and Bok Choy
data-lunch.desc: Your college diet has received an upgrade. This time, customize your bowl of ramen with fresh ingredients like shiitake mushrooms, snow peas, and bok choy.
For a simple swap, trade standard noodles for spiralized carrots.
If a big ol' burger is too much for you to handle between meetings, munch on these smaller ‚Äî yet filling ‚Äî sliders, garnished with radishes and cucumbers.
Sure, tacos are filling and delicious but they aren't always healthy. A taco salad, however, is a safer bet.

data-lunch.dish: Butternut Squash and White Bean Soup
data-lunch.desc: Mash white beans to give this bean and couscous soup a creamy, decadent texture.
We bet when you reheat this spicy five-ingredient dish, your coworkers will ask what you're eating. See for yourself.

data-lunch.dish: Vietnamese Caramel Pork with Pickled Carrot Salad
data-lunch.desc: Seriously, this is just as good (if not, better) as eating takeout for lunch.
This flavorful stir-fry uses zucchini noodles instead of regular ones, making it both vegan and gluten-free.
We can't decide what we love more about this dish: the extra-crispy tofu or the hot Thai chili sauce that's drizzled on top. In any case, it's all delicious.
Spice up your boring pasta lunch with this tangy, creamy sauce and grilled chicken.
This heart-healthy, flavorful salad will keep you full without sending you into an afternoon slump.
What's not to love about caramelized beef wrapped in a crunchy piece of lettuce and topped with chilies and peanuts? Nothing, that's what.

data-lunch.dish: Soybean Pasta with Kale Pesto and Squash
data-lunch.desc: The colorful, healthy trio of flavors and textures is the perfect way to get out of a lunch rut.

data-dinner.desc: Make this awesome stir fried fish to get protein.
A mix of breadcrumbs, Italian sausage, and fontina = the best.
Our new favorite way to eat chicken parm.
With a little lemon and cajun season = üòç
Comfort food at its finest.
AKA, how to make greens way more exciting than wilted lettuce.
These are the prettiest low-carb tacos you'll ever see.
The lighter version of your favorite indulgent meal.
Even seafood haters can get behind this blackened tilapia.
Turn your leftovers into chicken salad or toss some into chicken noodle soup!
It's sooo pretty.
No need for take-out tonight!
That perfect summer flavor.
The most addicting salmon recipe ever.
Yes, you can make your own!
This knockout dish is so good, you won't miss the carbs.
A satisfying casserole with all of your fall favorites
Garlic lovers, this chicken is for you.
You've never had cauliflower like this before!
More meat. Less carbs.
